flawed_nl_solution:
If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=39>>39
Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.
Richard will be 40+39 = <<40+39=79>>79 years forty years from now.
Their combined ages forty years from now will be 79+54 = <<79+54=133>>133 years
#### 133

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 34, not 39. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
